sub_topic: Identifying the automorphism group of a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following undirected graph with 6 vertices and 6 edges:

![Graph](https://i.imgur.com/0JhO6Os.png)

What is the size of the automorphism group of this graph?
message_2:
An automorphism of a graph is a permutation of the vertices that preserves the adjacency relation. In other words, it is a bijective function that maps the vertices of the graph to themselves such that the edge structure is preserved.

In this graph, we can observe the following automorphisms:

1. The identity automorphism, which maps each vertex to itself.
2. A reflection along the horizontal axis, which swaps vertices A and F, B and E, and leaves C and D unchanged.
3. A reflection along the vertical axis, which swaps vertices A and B, E and F, and leaves C and D unchanged.
4. A 180-degree rotation, which swaps vertices A and E, B and F, and leaves C and D unchanged.

These are the only automorphisms that preserve the edge structure of the graph. Therefore, the size of the automorphism group of this graph is 4.
